body: Killed my dog We've fed Pedigree brand food to all our dogs since I can remember. This was my first time ordering online and my dog started diarrhea and vomiting after the first packet he ate, became listless and unable to eat or drink after a few days. Took him to emergency vet and he was given IVs and got better slowly. He had to re-learn to trust food and eat again. We thought perhaps just the one packet was contaminated and fed a second one after a few months, same reaction but this one was fatal after just 2 days. It was heartbreaking to see him writhe and cry out in pain the last 2 hours and then watch blood pour from his mouth. We were told it's because the poison in the food damaged his liver seriously. He didn't stand a chance of surviving this one.I will definitely not order from here or order Pedigree food from anywhere anymore.

body: SUPER Easy, Perfect for small-medium dogs + travel We got these because the cans weren't able to be ordered and we were in a pinch. We have an 8lb puppy (rat terrier) and a 25 lb dog (mini schnauzer). They go through about a pouch of day, mixed in with their kibbles and a little fresh chicken. That makes the 24 pouch packs ($7-$8 on Amazon) last almost a month (or $2/week) which is a fantastic deal. However, a much bigger dog would have issue with the size of each portion. I'd imagine they are PERFECT for travel, however, as the pouches are so convenient to pack, stack, store, etc. And less work than a can; plus, we don't have to store a big can of half used dog food in the fridge for days until they finish it, which is nice. I also like how they can stand up on their own, so we make a little row in our pantry.Flavor wise, they LOVE it. Unlike most canned food, which can congeal and be cold/hard/jelly-like once put in the fridge, this stuff has gravy and little flakes/chunks in it, which they really like.  The bonus is each pouch is served at room temp every time,  since there isn't enough (like a big can) to store.The ONE thing that is negative for me is the waste; I wish they used a more environmentally friendly packaging for this, like recycled plastic, or one of the more modern fibers that act like plastic without the damage. The cans are better in that metal is more easily made and recycled.

body: Way better than the canned version! I ordered these for our two medium sized dogs and they both love them. Our lab collie mix is kind of a finicky and slow eater, but he goes to town when I mix this in with his dry food. I like not filling the recycling with dog food cans, but I do have to say the pouch design can be a tiny bit cumbersome to empty completely.I did decide to buy the canned version of this dog food to try out, mostly because the price per ounce was significantly lower. I realize now why it’s so much cheaper—the chunks of “meat” look more like compressed pattè and the gravy looks more jelly-like. Our picky boy definitely noticed the difference and I will be going back to these pouches for him.

body: My picky eater LOVES these pouches. I don't know what it is about these pouches but my dog absolutely loves them. I've purchased higher quality foods that she turns her nose up at, but I pull these out and she goes crazy. The size really helps with portion control, which I love because I know I was likely over-feeding her with far too large portions when she was younger. I usually add fresh peas, carrots, a bit of dry dog food, and rarely a few small rice balls. My biggest complaint with these is always with the Grilled Chicken flavor. The other flavor pouches always have a good ratio of meat chunks to the gravy, but the Grilled Chicken is always like 70% gravy. There are different options when it comes to the boxes of choice cuts, so make sure you look around for the best price (like I've found a box of 24 that was cheaper than a box of 18).
